question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Determinism] Is ConvertVirtualAddressToContractAddressWithContractHashName at lines 115-116 deterministic and collision-resistant? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Null Return] Can organizationAddress or organizationHash be null in the returned OrganizationHashAddressPair at lines 118-122? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateVirtualHash()] [Null Token] At line 127, if creationToken is null, organizationHash is returned at line 128—can this enable organization address prediction? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateVirtualHash()] [Hash Collision] At line 129, can HashHelper.ConcatAndCompute produce collisions if organizationHash and creationToken are carefully crafted? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateVirtualHash()] [Null Input] If organizationHash is null, does line 128 or line 129 throw exception or return null hash? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateVirtualHash()] [Token Reuse] Can the same creationToken be reused across multiple organizations to create related/predictable addresses? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertProposalNotYetVotedBySender()] [Double Voting Prevention] At lines 134-135, if proposal lists contain duplicate sender addresses, does Contains() correctly detect double voting? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertProposalNotYetVotedBySender()] [Logic Error] Can a sender vote in one category (Approvals), fail this check, but still have their vote in another category (Rejections) count? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertProposalNotYetVotedBySender()] [Race Condition] Between checking isAlreadyVoted at lines 134-135 and adding new vote, can TOCTOU allow double voting in concurrent transactions? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertProposalNotYetVotedBySender()] [Null Sender] If sender parameter is null, does Contains() at lines 134-135 throw exception or return false? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertProposalNotYetVotedBySender()] [Gas Attack] If proposal vote lists are extremely large, can Contains() checks at lines 134-135 exceed gas limits? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: AssertProposalNotYetVotedBySender()] [Null Proposal] Does the function validate that proposal and its vote lists are not null before accessing them at lines 134-135? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [ID Collision] At line 142, does Context.GenerateId prevent proposal ID collisions if input.Token is null and HashHelper.ComputeFrom produces duplicate hashes? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [Token Reuse] Can an attacker reuse input.Token across different proposals to predict or collide proposal IDs? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [Null Coalescing] At line 142, if input.Token is null, HashHelper.ComputeFrom(input) is used—does this include all necessary input fields to prevent collisions? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [Context.Self Dependency] Does using Context.Self in GenerateId at line 142 prevent cross-contract proposal ID collisions? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: GenerateProposalId()] [Input Validation] Does the function validate that input is not null before calling HashHelper.ComputeFrom at line 142? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Input Validation] At line 147, CheckCreateProposalInput only validates length constraints—are other critical fields validated? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Proposal ID] At line 148, can GenerateProposalId produce colliding IDs allowing proposal replacement? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Double Validation] At line 162, Validate(proposal) is called after construction—can invalid proposals be constructed at lines 149-161? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [State Race] Between line 163 check (proposal doesn't exist) and line 164 (storing proposal), can another transaction create the same proposal ID? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Null Fields] At lines 149-161, are all proposal fields validated for null/invalid values before assignment? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Context.Sender] At line 157, proposal.Proposer is set to Context.Sender—is Context.Sender guaranteed to be authorized before this function is called? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [Organization Validation] Is input.OrganizationAddress validated to ensure it corresponds to a valid, existing organization before creating proposal? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Association/Association_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewProposal()] [ToAddress Validation] Is input.ToAddress at line 154 validated to ensure it points to a valid contract that has the specified ContractMethodName? (High)
